metadata.title: CVE-2023-0615 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw and potential divide by zero and Integer overflow wasfound in the Linux kernel V4L2 and vivid test code functionality. Thisissue occurs when a user triggers ioctls, such as VIDIOC_S_DV_TIMINGSioctl. This could allow a local user to crash the system if vivid test codeenabled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-204.215
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-204.215
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-139.156~18.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
